description: Use domain-specific language rooted in core business concepts. Avoid generic terms, technical patterns (Manager, Service, Handler, Factory), and capability verbs (Exposes, Provides, Contains). Name concepts and responsibilities using the ubiquitous language of the business domain.

do.description: Use concrete domain language with specific behaviors and actions

guidance.description: Name concepts after what they represent in the domain, not technical patterns
example: Calculates total value with market prices: Money, Holding, MarketPrice
Evaluates risk score: RiskScore, RiskModel, Holding, MarketData
Generates trades to achieve target allocation: Trade, Portfolio, TargetAllocation
Compares current allocation to target: AllocationDifference, Portfolio, TargetAllocation
(Concrete business concepts: Portfolio, Holding, Trade, not PortfolioManager, HoldingService)

guidance.description: Use domain verbs for responsibilities, not generic technical verbs
example: Calculates subtotal from items: Money, LineItem
Calculates shipping cost based on address: Money, ShippingAddress, ShippingMethod
Authorizes transaction with gateway: AuthorizationCode, PaymentGateway
(Business-meaningful verbs: calculates, authorizes, retrieves - not generic process, handle, manage)

guidance.description: Transform capability language into action language showing what happens and when
example: Calculates total value across holdings: Money, Holding, MarketPrice
Finds by account identifier: Portfolio, AccountId
(Specific actions with clear intent, not generic 'exposes')

guidance.description: Use domain-specific collaborator types that have business meaning
example: Calculates subtotal from items: Money, LineItem
Calculates shipping cost by method: Money, ShippingAddress, ShippingMethod
Authorizes with payment gateway: AuthorizationCode, PaymentGateway
(Collaborators: Money, ShippingAddress, AuthorizationCode have domain meaning)

dont.description: Don't use generic terms, technical patterns, or capability verbs

guidance.description: Don't name concepts with suffixes like Manager, Service, Handler, Factory
example: (Should be: Portfolio with clear responsibilities, not Manager/Service)

guidance.description: Don't use generic verbs like process, handle, manage when domain verbs exist
example: (Should be: Get line items: LineItem, Authorizes payment: Payment, Calculates shipping: Money, ShippingMethod)

guidance.description: Don't use capability verbs like Exposes, Provides, Contains, Represents
example: (Should be: Get holdings, Calculates total value: Money, Evaluates risk score: RiskScore - specific actions)

guidance.description: Don't use generic terms like Data, Config, Parameter, Result without domain context
example: (Should be: Generates trades: Trade, Get holdings: Holding)

guidance.description: Don't describe system structure instead of behavior
example: (Should be: Payment - Get authorization: AuthorizationCode, PaymentGateway)
